info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 1 at 11:37PM CDT until April 2 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS Omaha/Valley NE
info.description:
Recent radar trends show storms lined up back into Kansas. Some, if not most, of these storms will move through far southeast Nebraska the next several hours. Thus, minor flooding is possible.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Nebraska, including the following counties, Nemaha and Richardson.
* WHEN...Until 530 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1135 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Falls City, Verdon, Rulo, Stella, Shubert, Nemaha, Dawson, Salem, Preston, Barada, The Highway 75 And 8 Junction, Indian Cave State Park, Sac and Fox Nation Reservation, Camp Cornhusker and Iowa Reservation of Kansas and Nebraska.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT WEDNESDAY
